topics.title: ErgoHack Wallet Survey Project Introduction
topics.summary: ErgoMinnow introduces the Ergo Wallet Wonderland project created for ErgoHack VIII with CannonQ. The project compiled a comprehensive survey to understand wallet user preferences and improve the current wallet situation on Ergo, which has improved since Yoroi but still has room for enhancement.

topics.title: Survey Results and Top Wallet Analysis
topics.summary: The survey received 113 Sigmanaut responses covering six major wallets. Nautilus and Ergo Mobile emerged as top-rated wallets, with users appreciating their ease of use but requesting features like transaction history, in-wallet swaps, address books, and mobile versions.

topics.title: Ultimate Ergo Wallet Feature Requirements
topics.summary: The survey identified key features for the ultimate Ergo wallet: easy-to-use simple UI, asset and NFT support, Mixer integration, and transaction history. Mixer integration was highlighted as a potential game-changer, leveraging Ergo's open-source mixer in an open-source wallet.

topics.title: Ledger Hardware Wallet Integration Issues
topics.summary: Survey findings revealed that Ledger's requirement for sideloading or dev mode is hindering adoption among users. The community prefers official Ledger support over dev mode installation due to security concerns and lack of trust in sideloaded applications.

topics.title: Wallet Feature Usage and Community Preferences
topics.summary: Survey data showed sending/receiving tokens as the primary wallet function, followed by DEX trading. Users overwhelmingly value easy-to-use interfaces above all other features. In-wallet token swaps emerged as the most requested new feature, with multisig support also desired for project trust.

topics.title: Documentation Resource and Wallet Comparison
topics.summary: The project created a comprehensive 35-page document serving as a one-stop resource for wallet information, including tutorials, documentation links, and feature comparisons. The Satergo team contributed a useful chart comparing wallet capabilities, helping users and developers understand current wallet landscape.
